post.description: Add a sender domain to your account. Note that you must own any domains you wish to include in this list, as you will be required to verify and authenticate the emails sent via that domain. Find full details in the Sender Domains Guide.

tracking_subdomain.description: An optional subdomain used for click or open tracking and unsubscribe links

returnpath_subdomain.description: An optional subdomain to use as a return-path subdomain

auto_verify.description:
If true, verify the domain now removing the need to call the 'domain/verify' endpoint or wait for the periodic verification every 7 minutes.

Note: In order to successfully complete the verification, the 'tracking_subdomain' and 'returnpath_subdomain' must be configured in the domain DNS and propagated.

post.description: Add a new SMTP user to your account. Full details of the available options for new user accounts can be found in the SMTP User Guide.

username.description: A username to access the SMTP2go server.  Length = 5 to 100

email_password.description:
A valid SMTP2GO password for your new SMTP User.

Must contain at least: 8 characters, 1 digit, 1 symbol, 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter. Leave blank for an auto generated value.

description.description: A comment or description of your new SMTP User

custom_ratelimit.description: If true, a custom rate limit will be enabled for this user, and defined by the custom_ratelimit_value and custom_ratelimit_period.  Default: false

custom_ratelimit_value.description:
If passed, defines the limit of emails this user can send in the period specified in custom_ratelimit_period.

Note: Only stores this value if custom_ratelimit is true.

custom_ratelimit_period.description:
If passed, defines the period for which this user will be limited to the number of emails specified in custom_ratelimit_value.

Syntax: "\ [hour[s]|day[s]|week[s]|month[s]] [hh:mm:ss]".

Examples: "0:30:00", "1 hour", "2 days", "3 months", "4 months 5:00:00".

Note: Only stores this value if custom_ratelimit is true.

feedback_enabled.description: If true, custom feedback via the unsubscribe footer will be enabled and defined by the below settings.  Default: false

feedback_domain.description:
The domain to insert into the custom feedback links via the unsubscribe footer. Default: blank

Warning:
  • In order to use the SMTP2go feedback handling feature, this parameter needs to be set to "default"
  • Setting this value to anything other than "default", disables the ability for SMTP2go to correctly manage the feedback responses and should not normally be set to anything other than "default"

feedback_html.description:
The HTML content to insert into the custom feedback email body via the unsubscribe footer. Default: blank

System Variables (Only available here):
  • Unsubscribe URL = %%UNSUBSCRIBE%%
  • Email address = %%EMAIL%%

feedback_text.description:
The text content to insert into the custom feedback email body via the unsubscribe footer. Default: blank

System Variables (Only available here):
  • Unsubscribe URL = %%UNSUBSCRIBE%%
  • Email address = %%EMAIL%%

open_tracking_enabled.description: If true, open tracking will be enabled for this user.  Default: false

click_tracking_enabled.description: If true, click tracking will be enabled for this user.  Default: false

archive_enabled.description: If true, archiving (available on paid plans) will be enabled for this user.  Default: false.

audit_email.description: If passed, this email will be BCC'd on all emails sent by this SMTP User

bounce_notifications.description: If passed, will control how bounce notifications are handled. Must be one of [from, drop, or a valid email address]. [From] will return the email to sender, [drop] will discard the event, and the inclusion of an email address will send the event on to this account. Default is [from].

status.description: The initial status of the SMTP user, one of ['allowed', 'blocked', 'sandbox'], defaults to 'allowed'

subaccount_id.description: If you wish to make this API call on behalf of a subaccount then include its unique ID here

post.description: Update an SMTP user's details with the parameters passed. Full details of the available options for SMTP user accounts is found in the SMTP User Guide.

username.description: A valid SMTP2GO username of your existing SMTP User that you wish to edit

email_password.description: A valid SMTP2GO password for your new SMTP User. Must contain at least: 8 characters, 1 digit, symbol, uppercase letter, and lowercase letter. Leave blank for an auto generated value.

description.description: A comment or description of your new SMTP User

custom_ratelimit.description: If true, a custom rate limit will be enabled for this user, and defined by the custom_ratelimit_value and custom_ratelimit_period.  Default: false

custom_ratelimit_value.description: If passed, defines the maximum number of emails this user can send in the custom_ratelimit_period.  Values: 1 to 2147483647

custom_ratelimit_period.description: If passed, defines the period for which this user will be limited to the number of emails specified in custom_ratelimit_value.  Syntax: "<n> {hour[s]|day[s]|week[s]|month[s]}[,hh:mm:ss]".  Examples:  "1 day", "1 week", "1 month", "2 months 3:00:00"

feedback_enabled.description: If true, custom feedback via the unsubscribe footer will be enabled and defined by the below settings.  Default: false

feedback_domain.description: The domain to insert into the custom feedback links via the unsubscribe footer

feedback_html.description: The HTML content to insert into the custom feedback email body via the unsubscribe footer

feedback_text.description: The text content to insert into the custom feedback email body via the unsubscribe footer

open_tracking_enabled.description: If true, open tracking will be enabled for this user.  Default: false

click_tracking_enabled.description: If true, click tracking will be enabled for this user.  Default: false

archive_enabled.description: If true, archiving will be enabled for this user.  Default: false

audit_email.description: If passed, this email will be BCC'd on all emails sent by this SMTP User

bounce_notifications.description: If passed, will control how bounce notifications are handled. Must be one of [from, drop, or a valid email address]. [From] will return the email to sender, [drop] will discard the event, and the inclusion of an email address will send the event on to this account. Default is [from].

status.description: If passed will set the status of the SMTP user, one of ['allowed', 'blocked', 'sandbox']

post.description: Add one or more email addresses and domain names to your Allowed or Restricted Senders List. How this list of email addresses and domain names are used is shown by the current 'mode' value; if the Restrict Senders setting is on, they will form either a whitelist or blacklist. If the setting is off, the list will be disabled. Further details of the associated setting are found in the SMTP2GO Guides. Details of how this mode can be set via the update end-point, are given further in the documentation. A post to this endpoint will return a success, even if the Restrict Senders setting is not in use.

allowed_senders.description: Array of email addresses and domain names.

subaccount_id.description: If you wish to make this API call on behalf of a subaccount then include its unique ID here

How the email addresses and domain names are used is defined in the current 'mode' value - further details of these modes are found in the SMPT2GO Guides. Note that a post to this endpoint will return a success, even if the setting is not in use.

allowed_senders.description: Array of email addresses and domain names.

mode.description:
A string indicating how the list of email address and domain names is interpreted. and should be one of 'whitelist', 'blacklist' or 'disabled'.
Warning: Changing the mode to 'whitelist' or 'blacklist' disables the 'Sender Domains' and 'Single Sender Emails' features.

post.description: Send an email by passing a JSON email object

sender.description: The name and email address to send from, in the format Name <name@example.com>

to.description: An array of names and email addresses (up to 100) to send to, in the format Name <name@example.com>

cc.description: An array of names and email addresses (up to 100) to CC, in the format Name <name@example.com>

bcc.description: An array of names and email addresses (up to 100) to BCC, in the format Name <name@example.com>

subject.description: The subject of the email to be sent

html_body.description:
A HTML encoded email body. Either html_body or text_body is required if template_id is not passed.

Warning:
  • To correctly track clicking of URLs you must:
    • Enable click tracking for the API key
    • Insert a full anchor HTML element (not just the URL)
    • Include "https://" at the start of the HREF property

text_body.description: A plain text email body. Either html_body or text_body is required if template_id is not passed

custom_headers.description: An array of custom header objects to be applied to the email. For example, a Reply-To email can be specified here, with header Reply-To and value name@example.com

header.description: Custom header to add to the email

attachments.description: An array of attachment objects to be attached to the email

filename.description: The filename to use for this binary data

fileblob.description: The Base64 encoded binary data of the file. Required if no url is specified.

mimetype.description: The mimetype of the binary data

url.description: A URL pointing to the attachment data. The data is directly retrieved by our system, and cached for fast re-use for 24 hours. Required if no fileblob is specified

inlines.description: An array of images to be inlined into the email. Use an image in content as <img src="cid:filename"/>

filename.description: The filename to use for this binary data

fileblob.description: The Base64 encoded binary data of the file. Required if no url is specified.

mimetype.description: The mimetype of the binary data

url.description: A URL pointing to the attachment data. The data is directly retrieved by our system, and cached for fast re-use for 24 hours. Required if no fileblob is specified

template_id.description: The ID of the template you wish to use

template_data.description: When a template_id is provided, include the pass-through values in the format {"variable1": "value1", "variable2": "value2"}

failed.description:
The number of emails that failed to send.

Note: An email with multiple recipients is classed as 1 email.

succeeded.description:
The number of emails that were successfully sent.

Note: An email with multiple recipients is classed as 1 email.

post.description:
Retrieve a list of up to 5,000 sent emails matching the supplied parameters.

The filter_query field can be used to create complex filters to make your searching more efficient. Find full details in the Email and Email Archive Guide.

Note: Allow around two minutes after delivery for recently sent emails to be included in a search result.

start_date.description: ISO-8601 formatted datetime. Results will be inclusive of this value. Timezone is UTC.  Defaults to current date at midnight.

end_date.description: ISO-8601 formatted datetime. Results will be inclusive of this value. Timezone is UTC.  Defaults to current date at midnight.

limit.description: The maximum number of emails to return. Enter an integer between 1 and 5,000. Defaults to 5,000.

status_counts.description: If true, will return an object with counts of each unique email status

opened_only.description:
If true, will return emails that have been opened by at least one recipient.

Note: Only returns information for emails sent from suitable accounts with Open Tracking enabled. See more info at Open Tracking

clicked_only.description:
If true, will return emails that have had a link clicked by at least one recipient.

Note: Only returns information for emails sent from suitable accounts with Click Tracking enabled. See more info at Click Tracking

ignore_case.description: If true, all string searches will be case insensitive

filter_query.description: If passed, will return results filtered by these search parameters. The query format is documented below

email_id.description: If passed, will only return emails with an ID contained within this array

username.description: If passed, will only return emails sent by this user

headers.description: If passed, will return the specified email header values

continue_token.description: If passed, the resulting query will paginate from the previous query

opens.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; CPU OS 9_3_5 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/601.1.46 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/13G36

user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; CPU OS 9_3_5 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/601.1.46 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/13G36

limit.description: The maximum number of emails to return (Default: 5,000)

username.description: If passed, only return email details sent by this user

recipient.description: If passed, only return emails with this recipient

sender.description: If passed, only return emails with this sender

envelope_from.description: If passed, only return emails with this envelope_from

subject.description: If passed, only return emails with this subject

headers.description: If passed, only return emails with this substring in the headers

continue_token.description: If passed, will continue the previous search if too many results were found.

url.description: A url that can be used to download the original email

post.description: Returns events (such as opens, unsubscribes) which match the filters passed. A count of events matching the filter is also included, as this may surpass the maximum of 100 items included within the response.

start_date.description: ISO-8601 formatted datetime which defaults to current date at midnight. The range will be inclusive of start_date and exclusive of end_date. Timezone is UTC.

end_date.description: ISO-8601 formatted datetime which defaults to now. Timezone is UTC.

search.description: If passed, will return all events for emails containing this string in any search fields. To return events with one or more text values, separate the text with '|' (e.g. 'text1 | text2')

search_subject.description: If passed, will return all events for emails containing this string in the email subject

search_sender.description: If passed, will return all events for emails containing this string in the email sender

search_recipient.description: If passed, will return all events for emails containing this string in the email recipient

search_usernames.description: If passed, will return all events for emails sent by this/these username/s

subaccounts.description: If passed, will return all events for emails sent by this/these subaccount_id/s (as returned from the /subaccount/search endpoint or as shown in the App)

limit.description: The maximum number of events to return (Max: 1000)

continue_token.description: If passed, will continue the search beyond the current page, using the same search parameters

only_latest.description: If true, will only return the most recent event for each email returned.  Default: false

only_latest_by_sent.description: If true, will only return the most recent event for each email returned ordered by sent date (overrides only_latest field).  Default: false

event_types.description:
If passed, will limit the returned events to the provided event types.

Values: 'processed', 'soft-bounced', 'hard-bounced', 'rejected', 'spam', 'delivered', 'unsubscribed', 'resubscribed', 'opened', 'clicked'

include_headers.description: Return the full email headers with the response

custom_headers.description: A list of header keys to parse out of the raw headers

email_id.description: The unique ID of the email which generated the event

date.description: An RFC3339 encoded timestamp with UTC timezone indicating the timestamp of the event

event.description: A string indicating the type of the event

username.description: The username used to send the email

reply_to.description: The value of the Reply-To header if present

sender.description: The From header of the email

sender_full.description: The From header of the email including name part if present

to.description: The value of the TO header

cc.description: The value of the CC header

bcc.description: The value of the BCC header

smtp_response.description: The SMTP response of the mail server

reason.description: The reason for an event occurring if present

host.description: The IP address of the host associated with the event

error.example: i/o timeout
error.description: The error message that occurred on certain events

outbound_ip.description: The Outbound IP Address if available

byte_size.description: The size of the email in bytes

headers.description: The full email headers if requested

custom_headers.description: An dictionary of key/value pairs of custom headers

delivery_attempts.description: A list of current delivery attempts if available (for processed events only)

smtptime.description: An RFC3339 encoded timestamp with UTC timezone indicating the timestamp of the delivery attempt

host.description: The host that generated the delivery attempt

smtpresponse.description: The SMTP response from the target server

total_events.description:
The total events available to be returned.
The actual number of events returned will depend on the number available and the 'limit' passed.

post.description: Adds a new email template that you can use to format your emails.

template_name.description: The name of the email template. Min length: 1 Character. Max length: 64 Characters.

id.description: The case-sensitive ID of the email template. Min length: 5 Character. Max length: 24 Characters.

subject.description: The subject of the email template.

html_body.description: The HTML body of the email template.

text_body.description: The Plain Text body of the email template.

template_variables.description: The variables to use within this email template in the format {"variable1": "value1", "variable2": "value2"}

tags.description: The list of Tags to associate to this email template

post.description: Changes details of an existing email template.

id.description: The ID of the email template that you wish to change

new_id.description: If provided, will update the email template ID

template_name.description: If provided, will update the email template name

subject.description: If provided, will update the email template subject

html_body.description: If provided, will update the email template HTML body

text_body.description: If provided, will update the email template Plain Text body

template_variables.description: The pass-through values required by the template in the format {"variable1": "value1", "variable2": "value2"} (When template_id is provided)

tags.description: If provided, will update the email template tags

post.description: Search your collection of email templates. Returns any templates that match your search criteria.

fuzzy_search.description: If provided, will determine whether search terms are matched exactly or using wildcards.  Default: false

search_terms.description: If provided, will return email templates containing any of the strings provided in name, tag, id or subject fields.

tags.description: If provided, will return email templates containing any of the tags provided

sort_direction.description:
If provided, will sort the returned email templates in ascending or descending order. Default: asc

Values: asc or desc

page_size.description: If provided, will limit the number of email templates returned

continue_token.description: If provided, will fetch the next page of results, following on from the previous page of results from which this continue token was returned

post.description: Send an SMS message to one or more numbers, up to a maximum of 100 numbers.

destination.description: An array of SMS numbers to send the message to (Maximum: 100 numbers). Numbers should include the country code of the recipient, and can optionally start with a plus symbol (+).

content.description: The content of the SMS. If more than 160 characters, will be sent as multiple text messages.

post.description: Retrieve a summary of SMS messages within a certain time range.

start_date.description: ISO-8601 formatted datetime which defaults to current date at midnight. The range will be inclusive of start_date and exclusive of end_date. Timezone is UTC.

end_date.description: ISO-8601 formatted datetime which defaults to now. Timezone is UTC.

total_messages.description: The total number of SMS messages sent within the passed time range

total_units.description: The total number of SMS units used to send the messages within the passed time range

total_cost.description: The total cost of the SMS messages within the passed time range
